style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

breweries.name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.
Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.

data.name: Farmageddon
data.description:
Bottle Conditioned Brett Saison

A special edition of our classic Farmhouse Saison, this version is aged in Brett barrels for 4-14 months. Because we're such a micro operation, each batch of Farmageddon varies slightly, reflecting the small blends we do, never combining more than 8-10 barrels. In some barrels we use more Brett Brux, in others Brett Lambicus. If this all sounds confusing, fear not — all you need to know is that the refined, effervescent beer that hibernates in these bottles is a dynamic labour of love, changing and improving with time.

Bellwoods Brewery is a new Toronto microbrewery, retail store & café coming to Ossington and Argyle early in 2012

We intend to produce a diverse range of craft ales and fermented elixirs for both wholesale and retail customers.

Bellwoods Brewery will also operate a small indoor picnic-style cafe in collaboration with local chefs for lovers of craft beer.

data.name: Farmer
data.description: In the shimmering heat of summer we call on the Farmer, who drenches our parched palates with cool, fresh-picked cucumber, infused in a spicy, hazy, sundrenched brew with a dazzling white head. The Farmer’s Belgian name is Saison, which becomes easier to pronounce as you sip.

breweries.name: Village Brewery
breweries.description:
Let us gather for mutual benefit. And beer.

Some of the best things happen over beer. Ideas are born, friendships forged, deals struck. Village Brewery began that way too, with friends sharing beers and dreams for a community brewery. A brewery that would support Calgary’s artists and craftspeople. A brewery that would create the excellent ales and lagers our friends and neighbors deserve. It takes a village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a village.

breweries.name: Frey's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.

We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

Since then, we've offered delicious food, quality ales & lagers, and friendly service. The Pint is open daily at 11 a.m. for lunch. data.name: Farmhand Saison
data.description: Our interpretation of this Southern-Belgian farmhouse ale uses a partial sour-mash and an addition of freshly ground black pepper. We use a unique strain of yeast from Belgium to add further layers of spice and complexity to this rare style of beer.

data.name: Farmhouse Ale
data.description: This beer has high fruitiness with a low hop bitterness and aroma. Great for spring and summer drinking, this light beer made with Pilsen, rye and just a touch of crystal malt, gives a perfect malt profile that compliments the Columbus, UK East Kent Goldings and Cascade hops. The Belgian Saison yeast works the magic to impart the wonderful qualities of a Belgian Farmhouse beer.

data.name: Farmhouse Ale
data.description: Good things come to those who wait. For Belgian farmers, it was the beer they brewed over the long winter months to produce a refreshing Saison for their seasonal workers to enjoy. Our Farmhouse Ale pays tribute to those innovators, who rewarded their farm hands with up to 5 liters for a day’s work.  Light, crisp, and semi-tart, this Farmhouse Ale will revitalize your palate. Pairs well with artisanal cheeses and grilled meats.

data.name: Farmhouse Ale
data.description: The WLBC Farmhouse Ale is our American interpretation of the classic Saison style that originated in the French speaking region of Belguim. Like the Saison (French for “Season”) of old, our ale is brewed to be refreshing yet complex summer ale. The saison style was truly defined by the region, so the Wooden Legs Brewing Company version calls on unique hops, grains and cereal of the USA. The grain bill consists of American ale malt, malted wheat and even a touch of corn. Crystal hops provide a mild floral and the spice to balance out the malt. The Belgian yeast provides additional subtle spices and esters and ferments to a wonderful cloudy complexion.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

breweries.name: Wooden Legs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Wooden Legs Brewing Company name is tongue in cheek homage to Judge Wilmot Wood Brookings. Judge Brookings is a significant figure in history of South Dakota. The county and city were named after him although he only visited the city twice.

In February 1858, Brookings rode a horse from Sioux Falls to the Yankton area during a blizzard. His horse slipped and fell into Split Rock Creek in the freezing weather. Brookings made it safely to Yankton, but his wet legs had suffered such severe frostbite they both needed to be amputated. He spent the rest of his life using a pair of squeaky, wooden legs.

data.name: Farmhouse Ale
data.description:
Broadly speaking, a farmhouse ale - or saison - is an esoteric style native to the French/Belgian border region. Characterized by a golden to light amber color, light to medium body, and noticeable fruity/spicy esters, this beer, known also as a “country ale” was traditionally brewed in primitive conditions in farmhouse breweries for consumption throughout the warm weather by seasonal farm workers.

Our Farmhouse Ale is an homage to traditional European beers brewed for quenching the thirst of farm workers, or “Saisonaires.” A unique Belgian Saison yeast is used to impart a mixture of spicy, fruity, & earthy notes along with lip-smacking palatability.

We brew a wide range of beers, from our year-round beers: Finestkind IPA, Old Brown Dog, Robust Porter, Star Island Single and Shoals Pale Ale; our seasonals to The Big Beer Series & our rare Smuttlabs releases; we brew something for everyone in the 24 states where we sell beer. Smuttynose is excited to begin production in it's new state-of-the-art, energy-stingy brewery in early 2014.  Please come visit for a tour or a bite in our restaurant.

data.description: For this somewhat funky farmhouse rendition of our flagship IPA, we took the base recipe and fermented it with a blend of French saison yeast and two strains of brettanomyces, followed by a healthy dry hopping with Galaxy hops. Drink now for maximum fresh hoppy flavor or cellar to develop the brett character. Santé!

breweries.name: River Horse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
You don't have to be in a dead end job to feel like you aren't going anywhere.  That's the way we felt before River Horse.  We were finance geeks living in a world without soul.  Grinding it out everyday for a fee, wearing suits and kissing butt.

Then this brewery chose us...she forced us to ask ourselves, "Is this desk job really how I pictured my life?"  We answered that questions by taking over River Horse in 2007 and have not looked back.  We may not end up as the greatest success story on earth, but at least we had the balls to try.  Sometimes, for better or worse, your dreams get the best of you.

Just remember, it's a big world out there and cubicles don't have doors, so you can walk out anytime.  Come see us when you can.  We are located in Lambertville, NJ on the banks of the Delaware.  Thanks for supporting the cause.  Hope you enjoy the beer...

breweries.name: Fitger's Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Fitger's Brewhouse is located in the ancient Fitger's Brewery, in Duluth. We serve our own award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers brewed on premise by Fitger's Brewhouse Master Brewers. North Shore style ales and lagers, brewed with fresh Lake Superior water.

Fitger’s Brewhouse opened in 1995, after its founders took a western-states ski trip and came back inspired by that region’s brewing scene. Combining the relaxed ambience of a high-mountain brewery with uncompromising dedication to quality, Fitger’s Brewhouse established a tradition of handcrafted beer, fantastic food and excellent entertainment on Lake Superior’s North Shore.

In 2012 Fitger's Brewhouse won a bronze at the Great American Beer Festival for their Fitger’s Framboise. In 2013 they have received multiple honors including “Best Reason to Save the Growler” by the Minneapolis Star Tribune, “Best of the Lake” by Lake Superior Magazine, and “Best Brew” by Duluth Superior Magazine.

This year Fitger's Brewhouse will produce more than 80 styles and nearly 3000 barrels of handcrafted beer. Our stage hosts eclectic local and touring entertainers six nights a week.

breweries.name: Werk Force Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Owned and operated by Brandon and Amanda Wright, Chicago Brew Werks and Werk Force Brewing are driven by a true passion for craft beer and community. Chicago Brew Werks is a full service brewing supply shop with a retail location in Plainfield, IL and web orders ship nationally. We are proud to hold the the Midwest’s largest selection of malted grains and we are the exclusive hops dealer in Chicagoland for Hop Head Farms. From the first time homebrewer to the professional, find everything you need to take your beer to the next level at Chicago Brew Werks.

With a foundation in homebrewing, Werk Force Brewing produces unique batches created by outside-of-the-box thinking. Utilizing the extensive ingredient selection available at Chicago Brew Werks, Werk Force Brewing stays on the cusp of the industry by brewing with experimental hops and yeast strains. Currently, Werk Force brews are available in house through our Tap Room.

breweries.name: Fullsteam Brewery
breweries.description:
Fullsteam is a Durham, North Carolina brewery inspired by the agricultural and culinary traditions of the South.

Our mission is to craft a distinctly Southern beer style using local farmed goods, heirloom grains, and Southern botanicals. Like what, you wonder? We're making beer with sweet potatoes, corn grits, summer basil, and malted barley house-smoked over hickory. Other successful "plow to pint" experiments to-date include beer brewed with scuppernong grapes, persimmon, paw paw, rhubarb and more. 

Ultimately, our vision is to craft a year-round, sustainable, scalable, and distinctly Southern beer brewed 100% with local ingredients. That's the quest. We're a long ways from realizing this vision, but we hope you enjoy the adventure as much as we expect to. Interested? Read more about Southern-style beer.

breweries.name: Arcadia Ales
breweries.description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

breweries.name: Rexx Reserve
breweries.description: Is somewhat of an open-ended project. Our brewers, George, Bob, & Eric come from diverse brewing backgrounds which we believe, despite butting heads occasionally, is a great strength to be harnessed. Rather than setting forth a staunch regiment of a certain style of beer, we want Rexx to grow and progress organically. The artist Robert Motherwell once said "A subject emerges from an interaction between my self, my I, and my medium." This is the same process we employ in the creation of our beers. Each beer is born out of a free flowing of ideas; a collaborative exchange of concepts between intellectual thesis and recipe. This then leads to lots of pilot brewing which often leads to further discussion of concept until ultimately either the beer style is determined by the concept or vice versa. This process allows for a great amount of freedom and creativity to already be present at the beginning of every new project.

data.name: Festival Saison
data.description:
Enjoy a creative take on a classic summer style, made with spicy rye malt and pink peppercorn for a zesty and refreshing thirst-quenching brew. Available exclusively at Arbor Brewing Company, with $1 per pint donated to support “Top of the Park”.

Festival Saison was created and offered in partnership with the Ann Arbor Summer Festival. It is on tap exclusively at ABC Brewpub and we donate one dollar from each pint sold to help support the festival.
data.foodPairings: The fruitiness and mild hopping of this beer make it a perfect pairing for foods with heat like Jamaican Jerk or spicy barbecue. Also great with citrusy salads and pork.

breweries.name: Arbor Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.

data.name: Field 2 Farmhouse Ale
data.description:
Field 2 is a complex and refreshing farmhouse ale that emphasizes the unique flavors of rustic yeast from a farm brewery on the French-Belgian border. With delicate notes of wild herbs, spices, pear, and straw, it’s no surprise that farmhouse ales once quenched field workers. Traditional hops from Bavaria and Slovenia lend pronounced aroma of lemongrass and earth to a gentle finish.
With ingredients that traveled far to come together, Field 2 is yet another transplant to New York that decided to stay. The name is taken from our preferred field in New York, found on the Great Lawn of Central Park.

breweries.name: Third Rail Beer
breweries.description:
Third Rail Beer is a New York City-based craft brewery, driven by a passion for the endless pursuit of quality, honoring brewing heritage, and pride in the culture and community of New York. We brew our beer using our recipes, techniques, and favorite ingredients on equipment lent to us by our brewery friends.

Third Rail beers offer sensory experiences that spark memorable moments and robust conversations, showcasing the wealth of variety and personality that comes from four simple ingredients. 

Look for us on draft at your favorite NYC beer bar, and keep an eye out for periodic limited bottled/canned releases.

data.name: Field Beer
data.description:
The farmhouse brewers of old based their recipes on what was available to them.  From this, a distinct terroir emerged.  To capture the essence of our own locale, we brew Field Beer with 100% Connecticut grown malted barley, and hop varieties that have proven successful in our region.  As our hop yard and the others around us mature, we will be switching to 100% CT grown hops.

Over the course of the year you will notice changes in Field Beer.  To emphasize the seasonality of agriculture and brewing, we will adjust the recipe each season to include a small percentage of an alternative grain while adjusting the hops to truly complement the character of our house yeast and Connecticut malt.

breweries.name: Tap Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!

The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.

data.name: Field Mouse's Farewell
data.description:
Fieldmouse’s Farewell is our late Spring/early Summer (come on Summer!) seasonal beer. A saison that is slightly sweeter, slightly more full-bodied and golden than Jack D’Or, and therefore might be slightly more approachable, depending on your taste for hops (fewer bittering hops in this beer). The hops are wonderful, old-world French hops from Alsace. We happened upon them, along with their representatives, at the Craft Brewers’ Conference and we were immediately smitten.

So, like a few of our other beers, this is a beer inspired by Europe, but brought into being in an American way. It is pretty much the best beer ever on a Spring evening when the sun tentatively brings you just a little warmth and a promise of adventures ahead.

breweries.name: Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project
breweries.description:
We are a gypsy brewery, without a permanent brewing home. We like it that way, we can be whatever we want to be on a shoestring budget. What more do you want than that?

Our flagship beer is Jack D'Or. Jack is the mournful grain of barley you can see to the right. He is the soul of beer, nature's magician, creating sugar from starch and bringing together the Pretty Things to produce the substance we adore: beer.

data.name: Fields Ablaze
data.description: This wonderful summer ale is both easy to drink and very refreshing! While most Saisons lean to the funky side of flavor and mouthfeel, our Fields Ablaze has a lightness and a cleanliness not seen very often.  There is a bouquet of light tartness with lemon and a floral yet spicy aroma. A clean malt character thrives with the addition of our own lemongrass and Seckal pear tea, stewed right here in the brewery.  The flavor is simple yet elegant with light malt sweetness and a slight grainy texture. The subtle finish will keep you coming back for more as a low bitterness allows for the crisp, clean finish that will rejuvenate both body and mind.
data.foodPairings: Fields ablaze pairs well with many foods. It can complement some spicy foods such as Cajun or spicy Asian dishes. It can pair beautifully with BBQ, balancing the richness of the sauce with the simple citrus, mild tartness, and low bitterness that is only enhanced by a pleasant carbonation. This same crispness pairs well with smoked sausage, oysters, and charcuterie.

breweries.name: Valiant Brewing
breweries.description:
Valiant Brewery was born out of a belief that an unforgettable beer experience could be achieved with every beer we brew. We set the bar extremely high, in fact it sometimes feels impossible. But, we are an inspired group.

“Be Valiant” is our rallying cry. It drives everything we do. Our inspiration comes from the valiant acts of ordinary people, who when faced with a challenge, achieve something extraordinary.

All of us at one time or another encounter adversity – a defining moment. It is at these times we learn who we are and what we are made of. It is our courage and determination that produce the best in us all.

At Valiant, we are determined to brew fresh, balanced, truly exceptional beer. We are committed to delivering an inspired beer experience with every beer.

So we raise our glass to thank and honor all of you who choose to Be Valiant.

data.name: Fields of Friendly Strife
data.description: Soured in our horizontal lacto tank, hopped with Chinook, Hersbrucker & the Falconer's Flight hop blend, then slowly fermented & aged in stainless with a blend of farmhouse ale yeasts & our house strain of brettanomyces bruxellensis for 3 months; tart, herbal, earthy, evocative.

breweries.description: Brewery and Tavern in SE Washington, DC.

breweries.name: Moor Beer Company
breweries.description:
Moor Beer Company brings you something different – a company dedicated to quality products, service to the community and social responsibility. We are not publicly traded and leave our accountability to the people that matter – our customers, employees, suppliers and families.

We strive to produce strongly flavoured beers of exceptional character. All our beers are brewed using only natural ingredients. We put a lot into our beers by using the finest malt, hops, yeast and water – but don’t take anything out. All our beers are unfiltered so they retain the yeast that is so vital to producing exceptional flavour, as well as providing vitamins.

data.name: Fig Saison Ale
data.description: Our take on the crisp, flavorful ales brewed by farmers specifically for summer refreshment, the Fig Saison starts with several varieties of wheat, barley, rye, and, of course, figs. With a complex mix of yeast and fruit aromas that perfectly match its higher level of carbonation, the Fig Saison pours a rich red color and finishes dry with a mix of fruit, floral, spice, and subtle fig-ish notes.

breweries.name: Ponysaurus Brewing
breweries.description:
Ponysaurus is a new brewery based in Durham, North Carolina, focused on perfecting balanced styles and finding ways to make beers you’ve always imagined.

Yes, our logo is a mix between a mean-looking Tyrannosaurus Rex and a stately-looking Equus Ferus Caballus. What’s better than a pony, and what’s better than a dinosaur? Both. 

We look at beer with a kind of childlike wonder. Beer is alchemy, the holiest magic. And even though we take what we do very seriously, we never want to forget how magical it is. The name constantly reminds us of that.

When you glance at our label, it looks classic and refined. Then you take a second look and you realize it's a horse with tiny T-Rex arms.

We wanted the name to have the same effect as the beer. To make you look—and taste—twice.

Also, it's pretty damn unforgettable.

Oh yeah. That guy up there grinnin' like a shot fox? That's Keil Jansen, our Brewmaster. He's alright.
